summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) notifying staff about scheduled oral arguments before the Second Circuit Court of Appeals for the week of April 26-30, 2021. It specifically mentions the oral argument in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, concerning her bail appeal.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

persons.name: Leval

events.title: Second Circuit Oral Argument in Maxwell Bail Appeal
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals hears oral arguments via phone/zoom in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically concerning her bail appeal. It was the first case on the calendar, scheduled for 10:00 am.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing for oral arguments in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals for the week of April 26-30, 2021.
One of the scheduled arguments was in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically regarding her bail appeal.
The oral arguments were to be conducted remotely via phone/zoom and were available for public listening via a livestream link.
The panel of judges hearing the arguments for that week consisted of Circuit Judges Leval, Lohier, and Sullivan.
